org.hrva.capture
Class CouchPush

java.lang.Object
  org.hrva.capture.CouchPush

public class CouchPush
extends java.lang.Object

Push HRT Feeds or Mappings to the CouchDB.

This is both a main program with a command-line interface, as well as object that can be used to push.

Typical use case

     CouchPush cp = new CouchPush();
     cp.open( "http://localhost:5984/database" );
     cp.push_feed( "some_feed_file.csv" );
     System.out.print( "Created "+cp.id );

When run as a main program, this uses a properties file and command-line arguments to determine the server, database, documents and attachments.

At the command line, it might look like this.

 java -cp LogCapture/dist/LogCapture.jar org.hrva.capture.CouchPush -m route -e 2012-03-12 route.csv
 java -cp LogCapture/dist/LogCapture.jar org.hrva.capture.CouchPush -m stop -e 2012-03-12 stop.csv
 java -cp LogCapture/dist/LogCapture.jar org.hrva.capture.CouchPush -m vehicle -e 2012-03-12 vehicle.csv

Depends on a hrtail.properties properties file.

couchpush.db_url
The database URL to use

Uses CouchDB4J

Uses Args4J

Also relevant are these projects

org.apache.commons.httpclient from hc.apache.org

org.json.simple from code.google.com

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Command-line program to push a file to the HRT couch DB.

All this does is read properties and invoke run_main

Parameters:
args - arguments

run_main

public void run_main(java.lang.String[] args)
              throws org.kohsuke.args4j.CmdLineException,
                     java.net.MalformedURLException,
                     java.io.IOException
Main program to parse arguments and push a feed or mapping file.

Parses command-line arguments. Builds document, posts document and puts attachment.

Accepts the following options

-f
This is a feed.
-m type
This is a mapping of type vehicle, route, stop.
-e yyyy-mm-d
The effective date of this mapping.
-v
Verbose logging.

This gets properties from the hrtail.properties file.

Parameters:
args -
Throws:
org.kohsuke.args4j.CmdLineException
java.net.MalformedURLException
java.io.IOException

open

public void open()
          throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
                 java.io.IOException
Opens the default CouchDB session and database.

This uses the couchpush.db_url property. By default this is http://localhost:5984/couchdbkit_test

Throws:
java.net.MalformedURLException
java.io.IOException

push_feed

public com.fourspaces.couchdb.Document push_feed(java.io.File attachment)
                                          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
Pushes a single feed file. Creates a feed document with timestamp, status and doc_type of "Feed". {"timestamp":"2012-03-03T04:03:12Z", "status":"new", "doc_type":"Feed" }

Parameters:
attachment - the File to push
Returns:
Document object that was created.
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException

push_mapping

public com.fourspaces.couchdb.Document push_mapping(java.lang.String mapping,
                                                    java.lang.String effective,
                                                    java.io.File attachment)
                                             throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
Pushes a single mapping file. Creates a feed document with timestamp, mapping type, effective date and doc_type of "Mapping". {"timestamp":"2012-03-03T04:03:12Z", "mapping_type":"vehicle", "effective_date":"2012-03-12", "doc_type":"Mapping" }

Parameters:
mapping - type of mapping; generally vehicle, route or stop.
effective - effective date string in the form yyyy-mm-dd.
attachment - the File to push
Returns:
Document object that was created.
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException

push

public boolean push(com.fourspaces.couchdb.Document document,
                    java.lang.String name,
                    java.io.Reader attachment)
Generic POST of a document following by a PUSH of an attachment.

Parameters:
document - the CouchDB Document instance to push; this is updated it id and rev.
name - the attachment name (generally feed or content)
attachment - a Reader for a File to attach
Returns:
True if the push was successful.
